 AAAC 2025 Call for Papers  
 AAAC 2025   
  The 16th Annual Meeting of Asian Association for Algorithms and Computation ( http://www.aa-ac.org/ ) will take place on May 31 and June 1, 2025, at the City University of Hong Kong, Hong Kong, China. We invite submissions of abstracts presenting original research or surveys of existing results in theoretical computer science. The meeting is a face-to-face event, and at least one author of each submission is expected to register and give the talk at the venue.  
 Topics  
 All areas of theoretical computer science, especially design and analysis of algorithms and complexity theory.  
 Submissions  
 Authors are invited to submit one-page (A4) abstracts (in pdf format) that can be based on original results or surveys of existing results of authors. Informal working notes including the one-page abstracts will be distributed at the meeting, which does not prevent any form of future publication of the same work. All submissions should be made electronically through the EasyChair Conference System:  
  href="https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=aaac2025" - https://easychair.org/conferences?conf=aaac2025
.  
 Important Dates  
 Submission due: February 28 (Fri), 2025 (AoE) 
  Notification: March 28 (Fri), 2025 
  Camera-ready version due: April 18 (Fri), 2025 
  Early Registration due: April 25 (Fri), 2025 
  Conference Dates: May 31(Sat)- June 1(Sun), 2025 
  Best Student Presentation Award  
 The Best Student Presentation will be awarded. A paper presentation is eligible for the Best Student Presentation if the author who presents the paper is a full-time student. Best student presentation award will be selected at the meeting by AAAC board members.  
  
 Registration  
 href="https://www.hkws.org/registration/aaac2025/reg.html" - Registration Link
Normal registration 1800 HKD  
 Student registration 900 HKD  
 Early bird registration by April 15  
  
 Sponsors  
 Details about sponsors will be updated.

"Call for Papers": "
# ACHI 2025: Call for Papers

The Eighteenth International Conference on Advances in Computer-Human Interaction, **ACHI 2025**, will take place from **May 18 to May 22, 2025**, in **Nice, France**.

ACHI 2025 addresses advances in human interactions with complex systems, covering interfaces, models, and challenging industrial applications and research topics.

Onsite and Online Options: We offer the option for either physical presence or virtual participation (pdf slides or pre-recorded videos).

## Topics

Topics are organized into tracks, including but not limited to:

*   **AI:** AI-powered ACHI, Human-centered AI design, Explainable and trustworthy AI, Multimodal interaction, AI in VR/AR, Adaptive user interfaces, Ethical considerations, AI and accessibility, Collaborative AI systems, Emotion recognition.
*   **INTER:** Graphical, Intelligent, Adaptive, Multi-modal, Context-based, VR/3D, Speech/Natural Language Interfaces, Interface design and evaluation.
*   **SUSTAIN-CHI:** CHI and sustainability, aligning with global challenges, supporting environmental changes.
*   **HUM-IND4.0:** Human-centered industrial technologies, process optimization, human-robot/agent interaction, Industry 4.0 challenges.
*   **OUI:** Organic user interfaces, materials, devices, flexible display technologies.
*   **HAPTIC:** Haptic interfaces, Tangible user interfaces, Haptic feedback/control, Sensor actuator design/evaluation.
*   **SYSTEMS:** Highly interactive, Intelligent, Adaptive, Context-aware, Multi-user multi-interface, Collaborative systems.
*   **DEVICES:** Interaction devices, VR input/output, Mobile/Pervasive devices, Tangible user interfaces, Wearable computing.
*   **DESIGN & EVAL:** Interaction & interface design & evaluation methods and tools.
*   **MODELS:** Cognitive, Conceptual, Mental models, Model-based design.
*   **USER:** User modeling and user focus, Usability and user experience.
*   **CHILDREN:** Children-computer interaction, designing for children.
*   **ELDERLY:** Designing for an aging population, smart environments, assistive approaches.
*   **PARADIGMS:** Traditional and emerging paradigms, Mobile/Wearable/Ubiquitous/Pervasive computing, Virtual/Augmented reality.
*   **ACCESS:** Usability and universal accessibility, Interaction/interface design for people with disabilities/young/elderly.
*   **HUMANWEB:** Human-Web Interaction, Natural language/Keyword-based interfaces, Adaptive Web interfaces.
*   **HUM-ROBOTS:** Human-robot interaction, Fundamentals, Cognitive models, User evaluations.
*   **HUM- AGENTS:** Agents and human interaction, Principles, Models, Socially intelligent agents.
*   **SOCIAL:** Social aspects of human-computer interaction, Societal implications, Social computing.
*   **GAMES:** Computer games and gaming, Technology, Engineering, Design, Serious games.
*   **EDUCATION:** Human-computer interaction in education and training, Interactive systems for education.
*   **MED APPS:** Applications in medicine, Interactive systems for medical applications/telemedicine.
*   **TELECONF:** Teleconferencing, Platforms, Devices, Videoconferencing, Web Conferencing.
*   **APPLICATIONS:** Other domain applications (scientific, engineering, business, arts & humanities).

## Important Dates

*   **Submission:** Feb 21, 2025
*   **Notification:** Mar 24, 2025
*   **Registration:** Apr 05, 2025
*   **Camera ready:** Apr 13, 2025

Deadlines differ for special tracks. Please consult the conference home page.

## Submission Types

We welcome academic, research, and industrial contributions including:
Regular papers, Short papers (work in progress), Ideas, Extended abstracts, Posters (paper-based/slide-based), Presentations (slide-based), Demos, Tutorial proposals, and Panel proposals.

## Formatting

*   Only .pdf or .doc files accepted.
*   Final manuscripts: 8.5\ x 11\"
column3: max 6 pages (up to 4 extra pages allowed at cost).

input:: *   Use ACM SIG Proceedings template or IARIA LaTeX templates.
*   Archived in the Open Access IARIA ThinkMind Digital Library.
*   Selected papers invited for extended versions in IARIA Journals.

output:: please refer to the contact information on the conference website.
